intro: Elatostema manillense var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaf elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is characterized by its small, ovate leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers with five petals, which bloom in the summer months. It is native to the Philippines and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
